home.heroTitle: Concrete solutions to improve the lives of individuals and families
home.heroSubtitle: Your trusted partner for non-refundable, concrete financing dedicated to improving family living conditions.
home.aboutTitle: Solidarity support for all those who feel without a solution
home.aboutDescription: Mon financement is a humanitarian aid program that grants non-refundable financing to people and families in difficulty. We intervene where precarity prevents progress: health, housing, education, projects, family stability... Simple, humane aid, without repayment conditions.
home.about10YearsTitle: More than a decade of action in service of the most vulnerable
home.about10YearsDesc: For over 10 years, Mon financement has been working with trusted partners to provide direct, humane, non-refundable aid to people affected by precarity. Each request is handled with seriousness, confidentiality and compassion.
home.offersSubtitle: Fonds d'Avenir offers several forms of non-refundable financial support, adapted to situations of vulnerability: health, housing, education, family, activity... Our aid is simple to apply for, structured, and distributed according to a strict framework of fairness.
home.aidHealthDesc: Medical care, emergency treatments, chronic conditions, prosthetics, operations... We intervene where health is threatened by lack of means.
home.aidHousingDesc: Unpaid rent, imminent eviction, emergency rehabilitation, access to decent housing... An absolute priority to guarantee family stability.
home.aidEducationDesc: School fees, educational materials, professional training, integration... We support the future of young people and adults in retraining.
home.aidProjectDesc: Launching a micro-activity, professional equipment, work tools... We support initiatives that promote economic autonomy.
home.aidFamilyDesc: Childcare, parental support, food aid, clothing, mobility... Concrete support for vulnerable families.
home.aidOtherDesc: Each situation is unique. We examine any justified request relating to an essential and documented need.
home.rulesSubtitle: A clear framework to ensure fair and equitable aid
home.rule1Desc: Only people in proven situations of precarity or justified need (health, housing, education, project...) can benefit.
home.rule2Desc: Critical cases (health, eviction, dependent children...) are treated as a priority.
home.rule3Desc: Only one financing can be granted per person or family over a given period.
home.rule4Desc: Any improper use of funds will result in immediate and irrevocable exclusion from the program.
home.statsDescription: Our actions are based on verifiable data. Every figure reflects our constant commitment, our operational efficiency, and our real impact on the ground.
home.stat1Desc: of requests have already been analyzed and processed
home.stat2Desc: Of the cases processed, received funding
home.stat4Desc: According to post-aid feedback from beneficiaries
home.teamDescription: Here are some members of our team. Dedicated professionals, offering precise and effective support, and ensuring rigorous analysis of each request.
home.partnersSubtitle: In collaboration with recognized international institutions
home.ctaSubtitle: Join thousands of people who have already benefited from our support

offers.heroSubtitle: Concrete assistance to meet essential needs
offers.introText: Mon financement offers several forms of non-repayable financial support, adapted to situations of vulnerability: health, housing, education, family, activity... Our assistance is simple to request, supervised, and distributed according to a strict framework of equity.
offers.offer1Desc: Financial support to cover school, university or vocational training costs.
offers.offer2Desc: With Monfinancement, benefit from non-repayable financial aid in the form of a financial grant from the IMF budget, the World Bank and the European Central Bank for your development projects.
offers.offer3Desc: Intended for people living in extreme precarity or prolonged social exclusion.
offers.offer4Desc: To realize an essential personal project: Buying a house, reintegration, purchasing equipment...
offers.offer5Desc: Priority intervention to respond to critical situations: imminent eviction, violence, natural disaster...
offers.offer6Desc: Support for micro-projects with local impact: associative actions, community mutual aid, environmental projects.
offers.offer7Desc: Partial or total coverage of medical costs: essential care, interventions or specific medications.
offers.faqSubtitle: Frequently asked questions about our programs and procedures
offers.faq1Answer: It is a non-profit organization, governed by statutes, which grants non-repayable financial assistance to eligible beneficiaries.
offers.faq2Answer: For individuals or households in vulnerable situations, having an essential need related to one of the foundation's defined areas: education, health, emergency, structuring project, etc.
offers.faq3Answer: No. These are non-repayable grants. No repayment or financial consideration is required.
offers.faq4Question: What types of projects are concerned?
offers.faq4Answer: Any project aligned with the foundation's objectives: medical assistance, resuming studies, relaunching local activity, urgent need or project with direct social impact.
offers.faq5Answer: Online, via the form provided for this purpose, accompanied by supporting documents (identity, situation proof, project explanation, etc.).
offers.faq6Answer: They vary depending on the type of assistance, but include: project coherence, reality of need, applicant's situation, and the structure's processing capacity.
offers.faq7Answer: A response is generally provided within 7 to 15 business days from receipt of a complete file.
offers.faq8Question: Will there be fees to pay?
offers.faq8Answer: Yes. Depending on the case, minor fees related to file opening, document transmission or authentication may be borne by the applicant. The structure, thanks to IMF support, can however cover part of the administrative costs when justified. Fees do not in any way constitute a condition for obtaining assistance.
offers.faq9Answer: Each request is examined by an independent committee, based on objective criteria. No discrimination, personal preference or priority treatment is tolerated. Decision traceability is ensured at all stages.
offers.faq10Question: Can I track my request status?
offers.faq10Answer: Yes. An acknowledgment of receipt is systematically sent after submission. If needed, tracking can be done via the site using the tracking number or via a dedicated space, according to the current procedure.

footer.description: Your trusted partner for non-refundable financing. We connect you with the best funding opportunities.

about.heroSubtitle: Discover who we are and our social support mission
about.presentationP1: Monfinancement is a non-profit organization from the IMF, in collaboration with the World Bank, legally constituted in accordance with the texts governing foundations recognized as being of social utility. Its main mission is to provide non-repayable financial aid, strictly regulated, to individuals or groups meeting defined eligibility criteria.
about.presentationP2: The foundation's interventions are geared towards social, educational, medical, or emergency projects, guided by principles of public interest and neutrality. All of its actions are based on a statutory framework, an independent selection committee, and documented, traceable, and verifiable analysis procedures.
about.presentationP3: Monfinancement is your trusted partner for supportive and accessible financial assistance. Specialized in non-repayable loans, our mission is to support those going through difficult times or who need a helping hand to realize an essential project.
about.presentationP4: Whether you are a student, entrepreneur, parent, worker, or retiree, Monfinancement supports you in your steps with listening and kindness. Our team is committed to providing you with the advice, tools, and resources necessary to move forward serenely while building a more stable future.
about.objectivesSubtitle: In accordance with its statutes, the Monfinancement structure intervenes in areas of general interest, with a clearly defined social vocation. Its actions are framed by precise criteria and targeted intervention areas.
about.objective1Desc: Support professional integration through the financing of concrete projects carried by people in precarious situations.
about.objective2Desc: Provide temporary assistance in emergency situations, particularly in case of medical, family, or humanitarian difficulties.
about.objective3Desc: Support educational continuity through financial support for priority studies, training, or career changes.
about.objective4Desc: Contribute to local business recovery through support for the creation of micro-activities with social or economic purposes.
about.objective5Desc: Improve the living conditions of people in difficulty through targeted projects on housing, mobility, or essential needs.
about.objective6Desc: Promote equity of access to resources through non-discriminatory interventions, evaluated transparently.
about.processSubtitle: The assistance provided by the Monfinancement structure is subject to a formal instruction process, supervised by a multidisciplinary selection committee. Each request is studied individually according to a standardized methodology, aimed at guaranteeing transparency, equity, and compliance with the criteria defined by the structure's statutes.
about.step1Desc: The applicant fills out an online form accompanied by mandatory supporting documents (identity, situation, purpose of the request, etc.).
about.step2Desc: The administrative team carries out a preliminary compliance check (complete file, compliance with minimum criteria).
about.step3Desc: The file is submitted to the selection committee which carries out an objective evaluation, according to a defined eligibility grid.
about.step4Desc: The response is communicated in writing within an indicative timeframe of 7 to 24 hours, on business days. A justification is systematically provided in case of refusal.
about.step5Desc: If validated, the aid is released according to the planned procedures (transfer, direct payment, or other internal mechanisms).
about.step6Desc: Each file is archived in accordance with data protection rules. Follow-up can be carried out on certain funded projects.
about.teamDesc: Committed professionals for targeted and effective support, they ensure rigorous analysis of requests.
about.contactDesc: For any questions regarding our offers, your situation, or an ongoing process, our team remains at your service.
about.headquartersAddress: 700 19th Street, N.W., Washington, D.C. 20431, United States.
